fruitCare.name: Bunch Management
fruitCare.description: Practices to improve fruit quality and yield.
advantages: Improved fruit size, better fruit quality, increased yield.
precautions: Handle bunches carefully to avoid bruising.

diseases.name: Pitting (Fruit Peel Disease)
symptoms: Small pits or lesions on the fruit peel.

cure.name: Preventive treatments
cure.usage: Apply Topsin powder or Imida pesticide directly on the bunch in June-July, just as the hands are opening.

tips: Implement practices for export-grade bunches (especially for bunches emerging in Jan-Feb): Bud Injection, Bunch Spray, Flower Removal, Bagging, Hand Selection.

tips: Harvest at the correct stage of maturity for optimal flavor and shelf life.

nutrientProfile.name: Nitrogen
avoid: Deficiency leading to yellowing leaves, excess leading to lush foliage but poor fruit production.
tips: Monitor leaf color; adjust nitrogen fertilization accordingly.

nutrientProfile.name: Phosphorus
avoid: Deficiency leading to stunted growth; excess can interfere with micronutrient uptake.
tips: Ensure adequate phosphorus availability during early growth stages.

nutrientProfile.name: Potassium

nutrientProfile.name: Phosphorus

tips: Potassium is crucial for fruit development; monitor levels during fruit filling.
